abstract: The letter carriers are enlisting Ron Bloom, a former investment banker, and Lazard, the big financial firm, to help forge a strategy to revitalize the postal service.

lead_paragraph: The letter carriers are enlisting Ron Bloom, a former investment banker, and Lazard, the big financial firm, to help forge a strategy to revitalize the postal service, Natasha Singer of The New York Times reports. Read more »

headline.main: Postal Union Turns to Wall Street for Advice
